name: places/ChIJB1mVQZv2wokR8f5jrwutfH0
formattedAddress: W 168th St, New York, NY 10032, USA
adrFormatAddress: W 168th St, New York, NY 10032, USA

originalText.text: Ana and Chris have wonderful energy and are superb instructors. The studio is peaceful, welcoming and amazingly clean. My fellow practitioners are every size, shape, and color and come in for a variety of reasons. My story: I started my practice in March 2022 and started feeling the difference after 5-7 sessions. My chronic pain is no longer chronic, I can sleep better, and my mood has improved. After 3 months of practice (2-3 per week) I feel stronger, walk taller, and have muscles I forgot existed. Pilates in the Heights is a true hidden GEM in Washington Heights/Inwood. I can't recommend it enough.

originalText.text:
I have been going to Pilates in the Heights since 2015 and it has been a transformative experience.

I am a freelance textile conservator specializing in installing exhibitions. My job is very physical, and Pilates in the Heights has helped me heal past injuries and, just as important, work on my body to prevent new ones.

The beautiful studio is a clean, welcoming environment. My sessions with Ana are part meditative, part physical therapy and part exercise, tailored to my needs—no cookie-cutter solutions.

Ana and Chris really understand the body and are excellent communicators. There is no air of exclusivity or elitism. They treat their clients with respect, listening to their needs and concerns.

As someone who works for themselves, I appreciate and admire Ana and Chris for creating Pilates in the Heights. They are not part of a corporate gym whose goal is quantity and more quantity. Like so many of us in New York City, Ana and Chris are independent, relying on themselves and it’s so important to support these types of people and their businesses!

originalText.text: "Pilates in the Heights" is the best thing I could ever do for my body, mind and soul. Chris and Ana are lovely and very profesional. They really take care of every client in a very personal way and take the time to adapt each exercise to best suit your body and situation. I have been working with Chris and Ana for many years now, and they helped me recover from a shoulder injury, unbalanced hips due to my profession (saxophonist posture), and a C-section. The studio is beautiful, extremely clean, with tons of natural light and the perfect vibe to feel calm and relax. Every class is a new challenge and I have so much fun!!  I can't recommend this studio enough.

originalText.text: I have absolutely loved my time working with Pilates in the Heights! I've only been working with them for a few months, but I started feeling the physical differences within a few sessions. I grew up dancing and Pilates in the Heights has helped me to unlearn habits that have sustained pain since I was younger. Working with them was my first time trying pilates. Their ability to communicate and explain how exercises should be done / feel has been so helpful. I'm now learning how to properly use my body to feel like my best self. I can't recommend them enough!

originalText.text:
We all have different body shape, occupation and life style. And that can cause bad habits with using your body. The Pilates In The Heights is perfect place to develop your inner muscle and core.

During this pandemic, I could feel that the muscles that I built was gone. I was looking for a pilates studio near my neighborhood and I met this amazing studio: Pilates In The Heights.
Chris and Ana are the experts of pilates, they have long time experiences teaching every different body.
From few months, I could feel the difference. I start try to listen the voice of my body, where I use wrong way, what I should need to change. Chris and Ana were helping me to use my body in proper way.
I definitely recommend this studio who wants to find out how to use their body in right way.
